spec.audience: Mixed technical depth, high-level, tech industry
spec.tone: Deadpan corporate, technically precise, lightly funny
spec.visual_style: Deadpan corporate diagramming with dry humor, clean technical vector diagrams, crisp lines, subtle shadows, big central graphic, consistent title placement top-left
spec.color_palette: Slate, graphite, muted cyan, safety orange accents on off-white
constraints: Only include the exact text specified for the slide

slides.title: What matters
slides.intent: Cover slide stating what really matters in LLM latency.
slides.notes: Same waiting chat motif; new title.
slides.prompt: Deadpan corporate technical diagram, clean vector lines, subtle shadows, off-white background, muted slate + graphite with cyan and safety orange accents. Big central diagram, consistent title placement top-left. Only include the exact text specified. No other text or numbers. Title text in top-left: 'What matters'. Diagram: a large chat bubble with three loading dots, a small queue of office workers waiting with coffee cups, and a tiny hourglass. Only text: 'What matters'.
rubric: The slide uses a clean, technical diagram style with deadpan humor.
Title text reads exactly 'What matters'.
No extra text appears beyond the specified labels.
A chat bubble with loading dots and a waiting queue are visible.

slides.title: What makes it slow?
slides.intent: Section opener for what makes LLMs slow.
slides.prompt: Deadpan corporate technical diagram, clean vector lines, subtle shadows, off-white background, muted slate + graphite with cyan and safety orange accents. Big central diagram, consistent title placement top-left. Only include the exact text specified. No other text or numbers. Title text in top-left: 'What makes it slow?'. Diagram: A signpost pointing to a schematic request conveyor with token pills, and a small warning triangle. Only text: 'What makes it slow?'.
rubric: The slide uses a clean, technical diagram style with deadpan humor.
Title text reads exactly 'What makes it slow?'.
No extra text appears beyond the specified labels.
The slide clearly reads as a section opener.

slides.title: TTFT vs TBT
slides.intent: Show a single request as tokens; prompt tokens labeled TTFT, output tokens labeled TBT. Output time is TBT times number of output tokens.
slides.prompt: Deadpan corporate technical diagram, clean vector lines, subtle shadows, off-white background, muted slate + graphite with cyan and safety orange accents. Big central diagram, consistent title placement top-left. Only include the exact text specified. No other text or numbers. Title text in top-left: 'TTFT vs TBT'. Diagram: A single horizontal request strip of token pills. Left segment (prompt tokens) is bracketed and labeled 'TTFT'. Right segment (output tokens) has repeated spacing and is labeled 'TBT' with a small 'x N' under the output segment. Only text: 'TTFT', 'TBT', 'x N'.
rubric: The slide uses a clean, technical diagram style with deadpan humor.
Title text reads exactly 'TTFT vs TBT'.
No extra text appears beyond the specified labels.
A full request token strip is visible with prompt and output segments.
The prompt segment is labeled 'TTFT'.
The output segment is labeled 'TBT' and marked with 'x N'.

slides.title: End-to-end latency
slides.intent: End-to-end latency includes network, queue, prefill, decode, and service time.
slides.prompt: Deadpan corporate technical diagram, clean vector lines, subtle shadows, off-white background, muted slate + graphite with cyan and safety orange accents. Big central diagram, consistent title placement top-left. Only include the exact text specified. No other text or numbers. Title text in top-left: 'End-to-end latency'. Diagram: A single horizontal pipeline bar split into labeled segments: 'network', 'queue', 'prefill', 'decode', 'service'. Only text: 'End-to-end latency', 'network', 'queue', 'prefill', 'decode', 'service'.
rubric: The slide uses a clean, technical diagram style with deadpan humor.
Title text reads exactly 'End-to-end latency'.
No extra text appears beyond the specified labels.
Pipeline includes network, queue, prefill, decode, and service segments.
Labels are short and legible.

slides.title: Why output dominates
slides.intent: Technical explanation: decode is sequential and repeats full forward pass per token.
slides.prompt: Deadpan corporate technical diagram, clean vector lines, subtle shadows, off-white background, muted slate + graphite with cyan and safety orange accents. Big central diagram, consistent title placement top-left. Only include the exact text specified. No other text or numbers. Title text in top-left: 'Why output dominates'. Diagram: A short input block goes through one compute block once. Then a long chain of output tokens each passes through repeated identical compute blocks, showing sequential steps. Only text: 'Why output dominates'.
rubric: The slide uses a clean, technical diagram style with deadpan humor.
Title text reads exactly 'Why output dominates'.
No extra text appears beyond the specified labels.
Output tokens are shown going through repeated compute blocks sequentially.
Input appears processed once while output repeats many steps.

slides.title: Trade-off Between Latency and Throughput
slides.intent: Scatter plot with many points; trend upward.
slides.prompt: Deadpan corporate technical diagram, clean vector lines, subtle shadows, off-white background, muted slate + graphite with cyan and safety orange accents. Big central diagram, consistent title placement top-left. Only include the exact text specified. No other text or numbers. Title text in top-left: 'Trade-off Between Latency and Throughput'. Diagram: A scatter plot with many dots (50+). X-axis labeled 'tok/min/GPU', Y-axis labeled 'ms/token'. Trend is upward but noisy. Only text: 'Trade-off Between Latency and Throughput', 'tok/min/GPU', 'ms/token'.

slides.title: Batching

slides.title: Do the work
slides.intent: Over-the-top joke slide: the real lesson is doing your own work (build your own slides).
slides.notes: Giant stamp slams a slide icon; deadpan humor.
slides.prompt: Deadpan corporate technical diagram, clean vector lines, subtle shadows, off-white background, muted slate + graphite with cyan and safety orange accents. Big central diagram, consistent title placement top-left. Only include the exact text specified. No other text or numbers. Title text in top-left: 'Do the work'.
